titleproper.value:
Guide to the Records of the New York University Sesquicentennial Celebration
                    <num>RG 46.1</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Darren W. Johnson.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2012-08-03T15:53-0400</date>

unittitle.value: Records of the New York University Sesquicentennial Celebration

p.value: Every University school offered symposia, lectures, and other sesquicentennial events throughout the academic year. There were also musical and dance performances, guided walking tours, special exhibits at the Grey Art Gallery, and a series of television and radio specials about NYU and its history.

The collection recounts the development of the celebration from early planning in 1978 to commencement exercises in 1982. It documents the creation of the Advisory and Executive Committees, alumni involvement, the study of other universities' anniversary celebrations, and the planning, organization, marketing, and branding of the events throughout the NYU community. Also included are budget and fundraising reports. Overall, the collection provides a portrait of the organization of a major anniversary celebration.

subject.value: New York University |x Centennial celebrations, etc.
Universities and colleges |x Alumni and alumnae.
